titleStmt.title: A pleasant new ditty: intituled, Though rich golden booties your luck was to catch, your last was the best, 'cause you met with your match To the tune of, I know what I know.

publicationStmt.publisher: for I. Wright junior, dwelling at the upper end of the Old Baily,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "A rich wealthy batchelour thirty and odde,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the upper end of the Old Baily
